intro: Chomelia sandwicensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian chomelia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is typically found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
